00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Cost matrix transformation functions.
00003  *
00004  * Cost matrix transformation functions for the bottleneck traveling salesman
00005  * problem (BTSP).
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "btsp.h"
00012 
00013 /****************************************************************************
00014  * Private structures
00015  ****************************************************************************/
00016 typedef struct fun_data
00017 {
00018     arrow_btsp_fun *fun;            /**< cost matrix function */
00019     arrow_problem *base_problem;    /**< base problem for function */
00020     int min_cost;               /**< min cost to consider for active edges */
00021     int max_cost;               /**< max cost to consider for active edges */
00022 } fun_data;
00023 
00024 
00025 /****************************************************************************
00026  * Private function prototypes
00027  ****************************************************************************/
00028 /**
00029  *  @brief  Creates a shallow data structure with data applied with given
00030  *          cost matrix function and some base problem.
00031  *  @param  fun [in] the cost matrix function
00032  *  @param  old_problem [in] the base problem
00033  *  @param  min_cost [in] min_cost to consider for active edges
00034  *  @param  max_cost [in] max_cost to consider for active edges
00035  *  @param  new_problem [out] the newly created, "shallow" problem
00036  */
00037 int
00038 apply_shallow(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00039               int min_cost, int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00040 
00041 /**
00042  *  @brief  Creates a deep data structure with data applied with given
00043  *          cost matrix function and some base problem.
00044  *  @param  fun [in] the cost matrix function
00045  *  @param  old_problem [in] the base problem
00046  *  @param  min_cost [in] min_cost to consider for active edges
00047  *  @param  max_cost [in] max_cost to consider for active edges
00048  *  @param  new_problem [out] the newly created, "deep" problem
00049  */
00050 int
00051 apply_deep(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00052            int min_cost, int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00053 
00054 /**
00055  *  @brief  Cost function for problems based upon cost matrix functions.
00056  *  @param  this [in] problem structure
00057  *  @param  i [in] id of starting node
00058  *  @param  j [in] id of ending node
00059  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00060  */
00061 int 
00062 fun_get_cost(arrow_problem *this, int i, int j);
00063 
00064 /**
00065  *  @brief  Destructs problem based upon cost matrix functions.
00066  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00067  */
00068 void 
00069 fun_destruct(arrow_problem *problem);
00070 
00071 /**
00072  *  @brief  Cost function for problems based upon Concorde's data structure.
00073  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00074  *  @param  i [in] id of starting node
00075  *  @param  j [in] id of ending node
00076  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00077  */
00078 int 
00079 cc_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  *  @brief  Destructs problems based upon Concorde's data structure
00083  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00084  */
00085 void
00086 cc_destruct(arrow_problem *problem);

00088 
00089 /****************************************************************************
00090  * Public function implementations
00091  ****************************************************************************/
00092 int
00093 arrow_btsp_fun_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00094                      int min_cost, int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00095 {
00096     new_problem->size = old_problem->size;
00097     new_problem->symmetric = old_problem->symmetric;
00098     new_problem->fixed_edges = old_problem->fixed_edges;
00099     new_problem->shallow = fun->shallow;
00100     strcpy(new_problem->name, old_problem->name);
00101     
00102     if(!fun->initialize(fun))
00103     {
00104         arrow_print_error("Error initializing cost matrix function.");
00105         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00106     }
00107     
00108     if(fun->shallow)
00109         return apply_shallow(fun, old_problem, min_cost, max_cost, new_problem);
00110     else
00111         return apply_deep(fun, old_problem, min_cost, max_cost, new_problem);
00112 }
00113 
00114 void
00115 arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00116 {
00117     fun->destruct(fun);
00118 }
00119 
00120 
00121 /****************************************************************************
00122  * Private function implementations
00123  ****************************************************************************/
00124 int
00125 apply_shallow(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00126               int min_cost, int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00127 {
00128     fun_data *data = NULL;
00129     if((data = malloc(sizeof(fun_data))) == NULL)
00130     {
00131         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for fun_data");
00132         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00133     }
00134     
00135     data->fun = fun;
00136     data->base_problem = old_problem;
00137     data->min_cost = min_cost;
00138     data->max_cost = max_cost;
00139     
00140     new_problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_DATA_BTSP_FUN;
00141     new_problem->data = (void *)data;
00142     new_problem->get_cost = fun_get_cost;
00143     new_problem->destruct = fun_destruct;
00144     
00145     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00146 }
00147 
00148 int
00149 apply_deep(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00150            int min_cost, int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00151 {
00152     int i, j;
00153     int size = old_problem->size;
00154     
00155     CCdatagroup *dat = NULL;
00156     if((dat = malloc(sizeof(CCdatagroup))) == NULL)
00157     {
00158         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for CCdatagroup");
00159         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00160     }
00161     
00162     if(!arrow_util_CCdatagroup_init_matrix(size, dat))
00163     {
00164         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for CC matrix");
00165         free(dat);
00166         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00167     }
00168     
00169     for(i = 0; i < size; i++)
00170     {
00171         for(j = 0; j < i; j++)
00172             dat->adj[i][j] = 
00173                 fun->get_cost(fun, old_problem, min_cost, max_cost, i, j);
00174     }
00175     
00176     new_problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_DATA_CONCORDE;
00177     new_problem->data = (void *)dat;
00178     new_problem->get_cost = cc_get_cost;
00179     new_problem->destruct = cc_destruct;
00180 
00181     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00182 }
00183 
00184 int 
00185 fun_get_cost(arrow_problem *this, int i, int j)
00186 {
00187     fun_data *d = (fun_data *)(this->data);
00188     return d->fun->get_cost(d->fun, d->base_problem, d->min_cost, d->max_cost, i, j);
00189 }
00190 
00191 void 
00192 fun_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00193 { 
00194     if(problem->data != NULL)
00195         free(problem->data);
00196 }
00197 
00198 int 
00199 cc_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j)
00200 {
00201     CCdatagroup *dat = (CCdatagroup *)problem->data;    
00202     return dat->edgelen(i, j, dat);
00203 }
00204 
00205 void
00206 cc_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00207 {    
00208     if(problem->data != NULL)
00209     {
00210         CCdatagroup *dat = (CCdatagroup *)problem->data;
00211         CCutil_freedatagroup(dat);
00212         free(problem->data);
00213     }
00214 }
